snippet: As the stoppage on Wednesday showed, the modern world of stock trading is much quicker, more complex and reliant on sophisticated computers — and in many cases able to adapt.
abstract: Investors could still trade shares of companies listed on New York Stock Exchange, despite its lengthy stoppage for several hours, on so-called off-exchange markets.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: As the stoppage on Wednesday showed, the modern world of stock trading is much quicker, more complex and reliant on sophisticated computers — and in many cases able to adapt.

headline.main: An Offline N.Y.S.E. Makes Barely a Ripple in a Day’s Trading
headline.print_headline: Failure in New York Exchange Makes Barely a Ripple in the Day’s Trading
